Joint MLE under the binary misclassification model.

fit_misclass_mle.Rd

Estimates \theta, q0, and q1 by maximizing the joint likelihood built from labeled calibration data and unlabeled surrogate outputs, then obtains standard errors via the inverse Fisher information (observed and expected).

Usage

fit_misclass_mle(y_cal, yhat_cal, yhat_test, level = 0.9)

Arguments

y_cal

Human labels on the calibration split (0/1).

yhat_cal

Surrogate predictions on the calibration split (0/1).

yhat_test

Surrogate predictions on the unlabeled/test split (0/1).

level

Confidence level for the Wald intervals. Defaults to 0.90.

Value

A list containing the MLEs, variance-covariance matrices from the observed and expected Fisher information, and Wald intervals for \theta.

On this page
